field_organizers.processed: Asian/Pacific Studies Institute, Duke University; Duke Center for International & Global Studies; Center for Innovation Policy at Duke Law

field_description.processed:
Jimmy Goodrich, Vice President for Global Policy at the Semiconductor Industry Association, takes a closer look at global competition in the semiconductor industry.
 

Semiconductors are a critical technology, powering everything from telecommunications to cars to defense systems. Critically, the innovative nature of the semiconductor industry relies on a deeply globalized supply chain in which the U.S. and Taiwan play outsized roles.

China is investing heavily to bolster its own semiconductor industry, and the U.S. government is similarly preparing efforts to support the industry as it seeks to retain its historic technological leadership.

Register for the webinar via Zoom: https://bit.ly/ChinaInnovationSP22
